Authentication Mismatch Between Frontend and Backend: Frontend uses Neon Serverless Postgres auth with authClient.useSession() providing session.data.session.token. Backend middleware expects custom JWT verified by verifyAccessToken using JWT_SECRET. Result: All authenticated image saves fail with 401. Root cause: Dual auth systems (Neon frontend
Status: custom JWT backend) without integration. No user sync between Neon users and Prisma users table.
Notes: Integrate auth systems: either use Neon JWTs in backend middleware or migrate to unified JWT system. Sync users between Neon and Prisma users table on registration/login.

Fix: Missing Database Indexes on Foreign Keys: No @@index([userId]) on Session or GeneratedImage. findMany({where: {userId}}) and deleteMany({where: {userId}}) scan entire tables. Scales poorly >10k records/user. N+1 potential if expanding queries.
Status: Add @@index([userId]) to Session and GeneratedImage models in Prisma schema. Run migration to create indexes.
column10: High: Performance degrades significantly with data growth

Issue: Multiple Prisma Client Instances: New PrismaClient() per route file. Exhausts connection pool under concurrent load (Neon/Postgres limits ~20-100).
Fix: Create singleton PrismaClient instance in separate file (e.g.
Status: lib/prisma.js). Export single instance for use across all routes.
column10: High: Connection pool exhaustion under load

Fix: n8n Code node global.rateLimitStore. Lost on restart
Status: ineffective in PM2/cluster/Docker scale-out. No Redis.
Notes: Implement Redis-based rate limiting for distributed environments. Fallback to in-memory for single-instance deployments.
column11: High: Rate limits ineffective in production scale-out

Fix: No Transactions for Related Operations: Register user+session
Status: login deleteMany+create no $transaction. Partial failures leave orphan records.
Notes: Wrap related operations in Prisma $transaction. Ensure atomicity: either all operations succeed or all fail together.
column11: High: Partial failures leave orphan database records

Issue: Race Conditions on Unique Fields: Concurrent register same email/username: findFirst then create no lock/tx. Possible duplicates despite @unique.
Fix: Use Prisma's upsert or handle unique constraint errors with retry logic. Consider database-level constraints with proper error handling.
Notes: High: Race conditions allow duplicate user records
